description.narrative: Adolescents and young people, especially girls, have enhanced capacity for citizen engagement in decision-making bodies in targeted areas., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most deprived adolescents and youth are empowered to become social change agents towards creating an equitable, inclusive and peaceful society.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Adolescents and young people, especially girls, have enhanced capacity for citizen engagement in decision-making bodies in targeted areas.

description.narrative: The policy environment for youth-inclusive, participatory policy-making improved with the implementation of the multisectoral governmental roadmap ‘Paroles des jeunes' based on recommendations of the 2018 national participatory study on the aspirations of Nigerien youths with support from UNICEF. The National Strategy for Youth Entrepreneurship and the program budgets of four youth-focused ministries were revised to take into account youths' aspirations and the constraints faced by marginalised youths. A participatory intergenerational dialogue strategy was developed by the Ministry of Youth and is being piloted in 4 pilots municipalities to include youth in local local planning and decision-making processes. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:03/02/2020
